# Copilot Project Instructions

## 1. Versioning & Changelog
- Maintain a changelog file at the root of the project named CHANGELOG.md.
- Follow Semantic Versioning (MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH) for version numbers.

## 2. Commit Messages
- Use the Conventional Commits specification for commit messages.
- Format: <type>[optional scope]: <description>
- Example: feat(auth): add JWT token support

## 3. Code Style
- Follow the project's established code style guidelines.

## 4. Documentation
- Document all public functions and classes using JSDoc/TSDoc style comments.

## 5. Testing
- Write unit tests for all new features and bug fixes.
- Aim for at least 80% code coverage.

## 6. Pull Requests
- Ensure all tests pass before submitting a pull request.
- Include a description of the changes made and reference any related issues.

## 7. Security
- Regularly update dependencies to address security vulnerabilities.
- Avoid committing sensitive information (e.g., API keys, passwords) to the repository.

## 8. Code Reviews
- All code changes must be reviewed and approved by at least one other team member before merging.

## 9. Branching Strategy
- Use feature branches for new features and bug fixes.
- Merge feature branches into the main branch via pull requests.

## 10. Issue Tracking
- Use the project's issue tracker to log bugs, feature requests, and tasks.

## 11. Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD)
- Ensure that all code changes trigger automated builds and tests via the CI/CD pipeline.

## 12. Accessibility
- Follow web accessibility best practices to ensure the application is usable by all users.

## 13. Performance
- Optimize code and assets to ensure fast load times and responsiveness.
